Copier Performance Guarantees: Ensuring Reliability in Your Rental Agreement

June 23, 2025 Marga Enterprises

Choosing a copier rental isn't just about hardware specs or monthly fees—it’s also about ensuring consistent performance over time. That’s where Copier Performance Guarantees come in.

In this article, we’ll define what performance guarantees are, explore why they matter, highlight the common types of guarantees, and show how you can negotiate terms that protect your business. By the end, you’ll understand how these guarantees can make or break your copier rental experience.

What Are Copier Performance Guarantees?

Copier Performance Guarantees are contractual commitments from your rental provider. They ensure that the machine will meet specified uptime, print quality, and service standards throughout the rental period.

These guarantees provide assurance by including clauses such as:

  • Minimum uptime (e.g., 99%)

  • Maximum allowable downtime per month

  • Print quality thresholds (e.g., no more than X defects per 10,000 pages)

  • Response times for repairs and service

Essentially, these guarantees hold vendors accountable for keeping your equipment running smoothly.

Check out the full guide on Copier Performance Guarantees.

Why These Guarantees Matter

Including performance clauses in your copier agreement can give you several benefits:

  • Reliable Operations – Minimal downtime ensures your team stays productive

  • Cost Control – Penalties or service credits if performance falls short

  • Support Alignment – Quick responses when issues arise

  • Risk Mitigation – You won’t be stuck paying for poor performance

When you clearly define and enforce these expectations, copier rentals become a dependable business asset.

Common Elements of Performance Guarantees

Here are some typical clauses you should look for:

1. Uptime and Downtime Coverage

Specifies the guaranteed uptime percentage and ensures timely repairs or replacement equipment if downtime exceeds that threshold.

2. Print Quality Assurance

Sets clear standards for print clarity, color consistency, and defect limits. Failing to meet these may trigger service interventions.

3. Service Response Time

Defines how quickly technicians must respond (e.g., within 4 business hours) to fix issues that threaten uptime or quality.

4. Service Credits or Penalties

Specifies compensation—such as credits, waived fees, or free service—if the vendor misses performance targets.

How to Negotiate Stronger Guarantees

Ready to ensure better performance? Here’s how to negotiate more robust terms:

  1. Specify Measurable Metrics – Uptime % or max downtime hours, not just “reasonable time.”

  2. Include Remedies – Ask for service credits or fee waivers as compensation.

  3. Align with Regulatory Needs – If you're in a regulated industry, ensure the contract meets compliance with regulations.

  4. Relate Guarantees to Contract Clauses – Tie performance targets to things like early termination options in case of repeated failures.

  5. Cover Successors – If the lease is assigned, include guarantees in your subleasing and assignment provisions.

Monitoring and Enforcing the Guarantee

To make sure performance promises are met:

  • Track performance using machine logs, service records, and uptime reports

  • Report issues promptly and do so in writing

  • Follow stipulated procedures to claim service credits or remedies

  • Consider regular reviews with your vendor to address recurring issues

Consistent documentation is key if you need to enforce your rights.

When Performance Doesn’t Match Expectations

Even with guarantees, problems still occur. Here’s how to handle ongoing issues:

  • Document each failure and its impact

  • Invoke service credits or waive overage fees

  • Escalate in writing, referencing contract clauses

  • Use early termination clauses to exit the agreement if performance stays poor

  • Re-negotiate to strengthen future guarantees

Strong performance guarantees ensure you have recourse, rather than being stuck with a broken copier.

Final Thoughts: Make Performance Guarantees a Priority

By including clear Copier Performance Guarantees in your rental agreement, you’re not just protecting your investment—you’re ensuring continuous productivity, financial fairness, and reliable support.

Before you sign any copier rental contract, make sure it contains:

  • Measurable uptime and quality metrics

  • Defined response times and remedies

  • Reporting procedures

  • Ties to other contractual protections

Your copier rental should empower your team, not hinder them. Performance guarantees help make that happen.
